properties.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 4:07AM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Numerous cold, wet weather systems will continue to push through
the area over the next several days. Colder air is expected to
arrive with each sequential wave, thus snow levels will steadily
lower through the weekend. Many winter weather headlines have
been extended out though Tuesday, or have been expanded to cover
more area. Winter weather will continue into the middle of next
week.

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 3000 feet, heavy snow.
Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 feet. Winds gusting as
high as 35 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory between 2000 and
2500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8
inches.

* WHERE...The Winter Storm Warning includes elevations above 3000
feet in Jackson and western Douglas Counties, including Dead
Indian Memorial Road, Tiller-Trail Highway, and Highway 62 north
of Prospect. The Winter Weather Advisory covers elevations
between 2000 and 2500 feet, including Butte Falls, Ruch, the
hills surrounding Ashland, Jacksonville Hill, and portions of
Highways 140, 62, and 138.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Tuesday.
For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Monday to 10 AM PST
Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
